Because it's hard to swallow.Just like they initially did with the previous game's ending. Remember?Because it's raw\, it's powerful\, it's bare\, it's crude... Because it's human on a scale you may have never seen before.There were moments where I genuinely paused the game\, needing some air\, because of a dramatic scene that felt like a kick in the stomach... And there were moments where I genuinely smiled back to the screen\, in front of the cutest and emotional scenes you've seen in a videogame - even surpassing TLOU1.The amazing graphics and the beautiful soundtrack are the icing on the cake\, the catalysts of this emotional rollercoaster.Also\, enemy NPCs: another level of greatness has been accomplished here.They'll talk to each other\, calling themselves by names\, getting angry at you if you killed their companion\, and exchanging information about your position.The gameplay isn't new\, it's mostly a refined version of what we had in Part 1. Except for a couple of things:- The stealth feels great and realistic in this game\, it's something you'll crazily enjoy if it suits you.- The level design is insane this time\, elevating the gameplay to its maximum potential.Don't trust some angsty youtube guy. This game IS a PS4 must-play.… Expand
